dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, um, huge day yesterday, huh? The market just took a dive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host_B, um, huge day yesterday, huh? The market just took a dive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yeah, Host_A. Like, a massive plunge. The Dow, S&P, Nasdaq, all down significantly. The Dow alone lost over 1,400 points.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yeah, Host_A. Like, a massive plunge. The Dow, S and P, Nasdaq, all down significantly. The Dow alone lost over fourteen hundred points.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 5.2%, over 1,400 points, by mid-afternoon on Thursday, while the S&P 500 was down 4.2% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite lost 3.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's, uh, that's a big hit. What exactly triggered it, do you think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's, uh, that's a big hit. What exactly triggered it, do you think?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, two main things, I think. The Federal Reserve, they gave this really grim outlook, warning of a long economic recovery. [overlaps] And then...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, two main things, I think. The Federal Reserve, they gave this really grim outlook, warning of a long economic recovery. And then...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock market plunged on Thursday after the Federal Reserve warned of a long economic recovery from the coronavirus recession, and as investors begin to worry about a second wave of new cases as states reopen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And then the, like, the second wave fears?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then the, like, the second wave fears?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock market plunged on Thursday after the Federal Reserve warned of a long economic recovery from the coronavirus recession, and as investors begin to worry about a second wave of new cases as states reopen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! People are really starting to worry as states reopen. Like, Texas, for example, saw record hospitalizations after loosening restrictions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! People are really starting to worry as states reopen. Like, Texas, for example, saw record hospitalizations after loosening restrictions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wall Street is increasingly worried about a second wave of coronavirus infections: Texas, for example, was one of the first states to reopen, but recently reported three consecutive days of record hospitalizations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So all those 'reopening stocks' – airlines, cruises – that were doing so well, they just, uh, tanked?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So all those reopening stocks - airlines, cruises - that were doing so well, they just, uh, tanked?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stocks that would benefit from a reopeningincluding airlines, retailers and cruise operatorshave all plunged recently, after having led the market rally in the past few weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. They led the rally for a bit, but now they've all plunged. It's a real shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. They led the rally for a bit, but now they've all plunged. It's a real shift.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And jobless claims are still, like, super high too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And jobless claims are still, like, super high too, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, still 1.5 million more last week, and you know, 44 million total. The Fed said unemployment will stay high for *years*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, still one point five million more last week, and you know, forty four million total. The Fed said unemployment will stay high for years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Weekly jobless claims fell for the tenth week in a row on Thursday, with 1.5 million more Americans filing for unemployment during the week ending June 6. ... BIG NUMBER: MORE THAN 44 MILLION Thats how many people have filed for unemployment over the last three months... The Central Bank forecasted a long recovery, with unemployment set to remain high for years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] I know! And get this, earlier this week, the S&P 500 had actually turned positive for 2020. Can you believe it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And get this, earlier this week, the S and P five hundred had actually turned positive for twenty twenty. Can you believe it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 on Monday turned positive for 2020, fully recouping its losses from the coronavirus sell-off earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right! I remember hearing that. So it's, like, completely wiped out now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! I remember hearing that. So it's, like, completely wiped out now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's negative again for the year. But here's the kicker: tech stocks are still soaring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's negative again for the year. But here's the kicker: tech stocks are still soaring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 is on track for a third straight day of losses, turning negative for the year after briefly turning positive for 2020 earlier this week. ... Shares of Amazon, Apple, Netflix, Microsoft and Google-parent Alphabet have all been soaring recently, boosting the index higher.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw the Nasdaq hit a new record. So Amazon, Apple, all those guys are still doing well?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw the Nasdaq hit a new record. So Amazon, Apple, all those guys are still doing well?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That helped the Nasdaq hit a new record high on Wednesday, when it closed above 10,000 for the first time ever. Shares of Amazon, Apple, Netflix, Microsoft and Google-parent Alphabet have all been soaring recently, boosting the index higher.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Investors are rotating out of those reopening bets and into big tech. Those companies are basically carrying the Nasdaq right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Investors are rotating out of those reopening bets and into big tech. Those companies are basically carrying the Nasdaq right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With investors rotating out of stocks that would benefit from an economic reopening, big tech shares have made a comeback. That helped the Nasdaq hit a new record high on Wednesday, when it closed above 10,000 for the first time ever.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it's, uh, a really confusing picture, then. Grim outlook from the Fed, second wave worries, but tech is just, like, crushing it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's, uh, a really confusing picture, then. Grim outlook from the Fed, second wave worries, but tech is just, like, crushing it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. A lot of conflicting signals out there right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. A lot of conflicting signals out there right now.
